title: Ticket #1483: Create DAG node status file
description:
(This is something that got talked about quite a while ago, but didn't make it to a ticket yet as far as I can see.)

Anyhow, the idea is that the user would be able to specify a 'node status' file that DAGMan would periodically update. The file would get overwritten each time, so it would be a snapshot of the state of the DAG at a particular time, as opposed to a history of the DAG.

This file could get re-written at the same place in the code that we write the DOT file, if there is one.

I'm thinking of a format something like this: 

  BEGIN (timestamp)
  State of DAG <dag file name>
  <node name>: <status> [<additional info>]
  ...
  END (timestamp)

The additional info could be things like the number of job procs for a node that are idle and held if the status of the node is queued. (The status possibilities I'm thinking of are: un-ready, pre, ready, queued, post, done, and failed.)
